citeinfo.origin: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.).; Dept. of Geography and Anthropology.
citeinfo.title: Maryland County Boundary FIles, 1890-1910

descript.abstract: This polygon theme contains county boundaries for Maryland for the years 1980-1910. The Historical United States County Boundary Files 1790 - 1999 (or HUSCO 1790 - 1999) contains U.S. county boundary files for each decade from 1790 through 1990 (also 1999). Files include county and state names and FIPS identification numbers.
descript.purpose: For research purposes only. May only be used by current members of Columbia University.

cntorgp.cntorg: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.).; Dept. of Geography and Anthropology.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Internally calculated area of the feature
Internally calculated perimiter of the feature
County name. Indian territories and some unnamed counties are blank in the "County" field due to the fact that they were unorganized or Indian territories
State Name. Some counties or territories are identified by the present name in the 'State' field rather than the territory name in certain decades before the particular territory achieved statehood.

1970 FIPS code number (counties created after 1970 are given their new official FIPS code) save for counties disestablished prior to 1970. In these cases, we assign them the first available even number in accordance with the alphabetical/numerical order of the counties/FIPS codes. Some very rare exceptions will include Indian Territories, phantom counties, and territories and states not parceled into counties at that time. These exceptions are usually given the FIPS code numbers of **999 or **000
Estimated area of the County in square miles
